result.execSummary:
The defendant James K Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

May be transferred to Milwaukee County.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Defendant is not to use or possess any weapons or firearms.
Forfeiture of weapon in question.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Not to be involved in any criminal behavior.
DNA waived, previously done.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant James K Ford in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendan guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
5 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )  consecutive to any other sentence
2 Years of Initial Confinement
3 Years of Extended Supervision
Term of Probation: 3 Years consecutive to any other sentence, may be transferred to Milwaukee County
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Not to be involved in any criminal behavior
Forfeiture and destruction of weapon 
Seek employment;
Defendant is not to use or possess any weapons or firearms.
COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA waived, previously done.  
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
